title.title: Letter from Joseph Spurlock to O. H. Crandall; July 14, 1869

editionStmt.edition: Edition created from new transcripts of this manuscript.

element.value: Funding for this project provided by the Mississippi Digital Library.; Funding for the project provided by the National Historical Publications and Records Commission of the National Archives; Funding for this project provided by the National Endowment for the Humanities.

element.label: Description
element.value: From the Mississippi Department of Archives and History Governor Ames Collection. Letter from Joseph Spurlock to O. H. Crandall, reporting the murder of J. J. Michie by J. M. Michie and requests that the Mississippi River be guarded above Vicksburg, Mississippi, and a reward affirmed.

element.value: Mississippi Department of Archives and History.

div.fw: Letter from Joseph Spurlock to O. H. Crandall; July 14, 1869
div.p: Editorial Note: Letter from Joseph Spurlock to O. H. Crandall; July 14, 1869 could not be located at the Mississippi Department of Archives and History (MDAH) for digitization at this time. Brief information about the missing document can be found below by selecting "Document Metadata" on the right hand tab beneath the document viewer, but please not that this information was based on MDAH's original itemized calendars and could not be compared against the document itself.
